content: life sized snake plant sansevieria sculpture in crochet by sharlene introduction i am a crazy plant lady when i am not actually gardening or reading about gardening or planning new garden beds or shopping for gardening supplies i have also managed to learn how to crochet basically so that i can make more plants out of crochet this pattern is to create a life-sized variegated snake plant it s a little challenging with working onto a wire but the actual stitches are simple and once mastered you can play with the size and type of snake plant you make yarn requirements i live in australia and access local craft stores spotlight and lincraft for yarn along with charity shops passing along pre-loved craft materials i use a wide variety of yarns almost all being acrylic and mostly in 8 ply for my patterns the most important characteristics are colour and look of the yarn to the finished plant i have only worked the pattern in acrylic yarn but i feel confident it will turn out well in any yarn you choose materials required 6mm and 5mm crochet hooks i use clover hooks but this is a personal preference i use them because they tend to stop the yarn splitting and allow you to work faster yarn in your choice of colours i used 2 balls of army green and 1 of sage from spotlight s 4 seasons 8 ply 100% acrylic range the 2 balls of army green are so i could work the spines from 2 separate balls all the yarn was not used in this project darning needles for sewing in ends 2 pairs of scissors a pair for yarn work and a specific pair for cutting duck tape and do not mix the two stitch markers in a variety of colours and sizes duck tape i use the genuine brand because it is more reliable wire from a roll 1mm in thickness plant pot of size to suit the project i located simple white pots at kmart australia measuring 11cm tall and 10cm diametre decorative stones to top the pot i used black stones felt in a shade to work with your project as supporting soil rotary cutter for felt optional but helps cut felt evenly and mat pliers with a built in wire cutter tape measure finished size diameter life sized to suit the pot used mine measures 55cm tall gauge not important abbreviations us terms chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch sm = stitch marker recipe instructions general this set of instructions should really be seen as a guide or recipe rather than an exact number of stitches the reason is that each wire length cut can have differences each person will put a different number of stitches onto the wire to cover it and in each specific leaf there is required slight variations in the row plus for each plant you will make multiple leaves
